Let's build on the awesome work <@U08C464NS> contributed: <https://github.com/dattnetwork/dattmedia>

<@U08ERPTQF|paul_xbt> uploaded a file: <https://dattnetwork.slack.com/files/paul_xbt/F08F98S2Z/dattdots.svg|DATTdots.svg> and commented: I've mocked up a throbber based on <@U08C464NS>'s animated logo

text: <@U08EZP01H|darrenm> has joined the channel
Hey Darren

Hey <@U08C464NS>, fellow UX/graphics nerd here. If you want to collab on any branding, UI, etc, let me know! I'm going to focus on some design research initially, starting with either a blueprint or customer journey map.

<@U08ERPTQF>: Cool animation man :simple_smile:. Just wanted to clarify about the logo. The idea is for it to mirror the function of the site, so the dots should appear to rise upwards. Same with the static version. Other than that, I like the bouncy nature of it!
I hit up your website. I really like your style. Super clean.

<@U08EZP01H>: Yeah man that sounds good. The logo is sorted, so I think developing the UI for the web app is the big thing. Check out the mock ups for DATT at <https://github.com/dattnetwork/dattmedia>
<@U08EZP01H>
<@U08EZP01H>: thanks :simple_smile:. Things are still up in the air with how the site will actually function so I've just been working on mockups and how things may possibly work
Do you do front end stuff?
The tip of the iceberg as needed, generally.
If it's not 'really' code, yes. My productivity drops once I reach into JS
ah yeah, same for me. I can fudge it if needed, but I'm nowhere near as productive
Are you in SF for the hackathon or remote?
I'm in the UK
you?
Seattle
I need to recharge my coffee status. Bbiab
k :stuck_out_tongue:
<@U08DH3ESU|aramkris> has joined the channel
(I'll pin this so new people can see) The design files and mockups are at <https://github.com/dattnetwork/dattmedia>

text: <@U08C464NS|chris> pinned a message to this channel.
<@U08F384H3|binyam> has joined the channel

<@U08C464NS>: can you expand on the 'rising up' design element. I get the shift of power, I'm just thinking more fluidly in that all nodes pass information/value to any other node if that makes sense.
oh no, I didn't mean rising up like that :stuck_out_tongue:
I mean like on Reddit, the best content rises to the top
I mentioned it in the design notes

I think the logo is good as it is now. The animated version I did could be improved to be more fluid, but that is only an aesthetic preference. The main meat of the logo is there already and perfect for different types of branding
Yea I'll reread the notes
When I saw the animated logo, I associated it with the passing of information/value, so perhaps there's another layer... brb

ah yeah, I can see that :simple_smile:. The reason I didn't do that originally was because it seemed a little too generic for a logo. How it is right now with the larger dots at the top is unique enough to stand out, and still communicate in an abstract way what the site's about :simple_smile:
basic user flow: <https://github.com/DarrenRM/dattmedia/blob/master/design_strategy/user_flow.png>
<@U08DD8LNP|go1dfish> has joined the channel
cool, didn't realize this channel was a thing, thanks <@U08EZP01H> I've started a basic UX/mock playground here: <http://dattnetwork.github.io/> <https://github.com/dattnetwork/datt.ui>

attachments.title: dattnetwork/datt.ui
attachments.text: datt.ui - Ember.js UX/mock playground that may eventually evolve into something useful

text: reading through the scroll back I should be a good complement to you guys, I hate messing with CSS and I focus on the logic/code to make interesting UX work and I've been building crazy interactive shit in browsers for years.  My biggest strength as of late is Ember.js I know it in and out and have been using it on my day job for about 3 years now
Hey that's great. We're definitely more graphics/researchy.

I think it's a very good fit for the sort of thick app we want to build out here, and it also has a very good separation between the logic and presentation that should let you guys be able to play with it without diving into the JS

<https://github.com/dattnetwork/datt.ui/tree/master/app/templates> will be interest to you guys as well as <https://github.com/dattnetwork/datt.ui/tree/master/app/style>  if you want to do SASS or LESS let me know and I can get that going for you
once you get node (I recommend nvm) and ember-cli running the app locally you'll be able to make template/style changes and have it auto refresh the browser for you
what's there now isn't so much exactly how I think the UX how to work, it's more of a basic setup to get started and a demonstration of what pattern of moderation/filtering I think could work well
I'll have to teach myself what I need tonight/tomorrow. Time to collect some new hats.
Things seem to be coming together well.
I didn't see your mocks before I started it I just used bootstrap cause again CSS is not my bag :simple_smile:  we can rip out bootstrap if you want though I'm just pulling it from a can
CDN* feel free to ask any questions the docs for ember kind of suck at the moment tbh cause it's in a transitional phase to 2.0
<@U08C464NS> did you have something in mind?
I've been doing bootstrap for a few years myself
great source of sideprojects
but once you get it installed you should be able to pretty much ignore all the ember stuff anyway aside from dealing with the handlebars template language
I'm working on HTML templates
but will be going to be soon (it's nearly 4am)
yeah if you'd rather go straight static mockups I can convert those easily enough into this as well once you're ready
Will think about it more tomorrow, my brain's fried :stuck_out_tongue:
If you need another design hand, let me know. And don't hesitate to sleep!
<@U08EZP01H>: how are you at converting PSD to html/css?

my goal is to get us a platform where you guys can go wild with design without caring much about the underlying architecture except as it relates to the high level structures we're still all trying to figure out :simple_smile:
I've gotten the nav/basic layout sorted, so all you'd need to do is the main content area/sidebar for each one
I rarely convert from PSD to template, much more experience re-using templates
k, no problem
I think Divshot is good stuff. Open Bazaar uses them
no that's the wrong thing. if i can find you the name of the software I used to use, Ill msg you
it's ok man, I'll finish it tomorrow morning
ok I'm out. Later people
<@U08CBD41G|delitzer> has joined the channel
<@U07GDL0H5|ryanxcharles> has joined the channel
